awd_titl_txt: Human Capital Accumulation and Equilibrium Job Assignment
awd_abstract_narration: This is a collaborative research project with Robert Miller at Carnegie         Mellon University.  The purpose of this research is to study the                initial phases of career development using data from the National               Longitudinal Surveys of Labor Market Experience of Youth.  There are            three components to the project: (1) to describe the patterns of job            and occupational mobility within the first decade after leaving school;         (2) to estimate a structural dynamic model of job changing behavior;            and (3) to estimate an equilibrium model of occupational choice.  This          project is important because it may change the way in which we think            about the standard human capital model of earnings growth, which                neglects job search behavior and labor mobility.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
